div.div: Sunny, with a high near 64. East northeast wind around 10 mph.

A chance of showers and thunderstorms. Partly cloudy, with a low around 39. East wind around 5 mph becoming southwest after midnight. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.
Sunny, with a high near 68. Breezy, with a northwest wind 5 to 10 mph increasing to 15 to 20 mph in the afternoon. Winds could gust as high as 25 mph.

p.b: DATE: April 9, 2020
TO: SCNUSD #5 Patrons, Staff & Students
FROM: Mrs. Julie Otero, Superintendent
SUBJECT: Latest Announcements in our District Related to COVID19 (4.9.20)
The most recent COVID19 Guidelines from Governor Ricketts include a Directive Health Measure wherein we will not return to the building during the 2019-2020 school year.

Graduation. This is scheduled for August 1st, 2020, at 1 PM at SC and 4 PM at LN. Awards will be given at graduation that would have been presented to the seniors at their Awards Night assembly. If the traditional graduation cannot be held at this time, a virtual graduation will be held in its place on August 1st.
Seniors’ Last Day. The seniors’ last day will continue to be Wednesday, May 6th.
MS/HS Awards Night. The Awards Night assembly for grades 6 - 11 will happen in the fall.
Prom. Unfortunately, because Prom will not be able to be held during the school year, there will be no high school-sponsored Prom.

MS/HS Third Quarter Grades. These will be stored as a percent and letter grade, and will be factored into high school GPAs, used to determine future valedictorian and salutatorian. Students will be awarded 50 percent credit (i.e. 2.5 credits for a 5.0 credit class, or 1.25 credits for a 2.5 credit class for the semester) for passing grades in the third quarter. Students have until Friday, April 17th to make up missing work from the third quarter. Third quarter grades will be stored permanently on Monday, April 20th.

MS/HS Fourth Quarter Grades. Middle and high school students will earn either a “Pass” or “No Pass” grade for the fourth quarter. Passing would result in earning the 2.5 credits per class for a 5.0 credit class for the quarter, which could be credits needed for high school (i.e., required core classes or meeting elective requirements).

Elementary Grades. Kindergarten and 1st grade have a standards-based rubric on their report cards. The K and 1st grades’ third quarter grades will be moved to the fourth quarter, and if a specific skill has been mastered and it has been documented during the fourth quarter, it will be noted. Second through fifth grades will be awarded with a “S” for Satisfactory or “NS” for Not Satisfactory, dependent upon if the work has, or has not been, completed for classes as assigned.
Valedictorian and Salutatorian for 2020. Valedictorian and salutatorian will be determined at the conclusion of the third quarter, when final grade percentages will be taken for the Class of 2020.

Credit Recovery. High school students missing credits needed for their specific grade level will be assigned to an online credit recovery course(s) beginning on Tuesday, May 19th, and continuing through June 25th, 2020, or until the credits are finished (students may finish early). This includes seniors who have not earned the necessary credits to graduate with a high school diploma.

Preschool and Elementary Summer School. At this time, we will still plan to have summer school, but the date may need to be postponed, depending on what health directive we are given prior to that time.
Final Grades. Final grades for the fourth quarter (and semester two) will continue to be due by Monday, May 18th.

CCC Classes. Students not finishing their CCC college credits have until Friday, April 24th, 2020, to withdraw from a spring semester course. Withdrawal would result in repayment to the district of $300, and there will be no high school or college credit granted. Students who choose to withdraw from a course will receive a grade of “W,” which does not affect their GPA. A “W” does not count toward a degree nor does it transfer to another institution. The student would also still be responsible for the tuition, if they have not paid. Withdrawal must be done through the high school guidance counselors through a drop/add form: Mrs. Porter at cporter@southcentralusd.us or Mrs. Bettasso at sbettasso@southcentralusd.us.
Incomplete Grade Contracts: Any class not completed for the spring semester, may take an incomplete BUT all work must be completed by Friday, August 7.

Final Grade Deadline for the Spring Semester: This will vary. If you know the end date of your course, the final grades are due two business days later. Classes with an end date of Friday, May 8, will have final grades due by 5 PM on Tuesday, May 12. Classes with an end date of Wednesday, May 13, final grades will be due by 5 PM on Tuesday, May 19. Please note these dates are specific to CCC classes.

Letter Grades vs. Pass/Fail or No Credit: Even if your high school has decided to go to Pass/Fail for the final high school grade, all CCC courses will be graded with letter grades per the CCC grade scale and entered into Moodle. This is required to avoid any possible transfer issues. Please reach out to your local ELS office if you have questions about this requirement.
Available Student Resources: CCC has the following student resources available at this link https://www.cccneb.edu/ecstudentresources

Students Who Have Elected NOT to do Any Work for Fourth Quarter & Have A School-Issued Electronic Device. If students are choosing not to complete assignments electronically and have been provided with a device, administration is asking the student/guardian to turn in the device so that packets can be put together by Friday, April 17th, 2020. Packet delivery will occur on a weekly or bi-weekly basis, and will be picked up on or around the due date listed.
Elementary Field Day and Awards Ceremony. The ceremony honoring our elementary students and the elementary track and field day will be held this fall.

Summer Custodial Work. Custodians will begin deep cleaning the rooms in the next two weeks. Because of the extended time for cleaning, no additional summer custodians will be hired. Staff are being asked to have their rooms/areas ready for typical summer cleaning no later than April 20, 2020.
NCAPS Presentations. Juniors and seniors are being asked to upload their NCAPS presentations by April 29th. Requirements of the presentation are linked here: https://bit.ly/NCAPS2020.

End of Year Deadlines & Technology Device Pick-up Dates. All student iPads, computers, chargers, laptop bags, textbooks and other materials owned by the school need to be turned back in prior to the semester ending. Because work will need to be completed prior to this, we have established the following deadlines:
Fri., May 8th (or a date determined by each site): Seniors will need to turn in all items belonging to the school, including all technology items, textbooks, jerseys, etc.
Wed., May 13th at 4 PM: All fourth quarter work must be completed by K-12 students.
Thu., May 14th, 8 AM - 6 PM: All technology devices, textbooks & other school materials need to be returned to the specific school site at your assigned time (TBD).
Fri., May 15th: Teacher Work Day to complete grading for fourth quarter.
Mon., May 18th by 12 PM: All grades must be completed by teachers for the fourth quarter.

Parents are reminded to please check on your child’s progress of work on PowerSchool through the portal at https://southcentral.powerschool.com/guardian/home.html. If you are having problems accessing the account, please select “forgot username” or “forgot password” to access the account. If that does not work, please call your site secretaries at:
Sandy Creek: 402-726-2151
Lawrence AND Nelson sites: 402-225-3371, ext. 6100

a.aria-label: Read more about SCNUSD #5 Shares COVID-19 Updated Information 4.9.20

h3.a: "Checking in" library books & finding more to read online...

div.h4: Turning in books via lunch delivery or at either school site

em.strong: Elementary and MS/HS students are asked to "check in" their library books one of the following ways today or Monday:

div.p: 1. Through the lunch delivery program. If you pick up lunch at either school location OR if you have rural delivery, please return your books to the driver OR just inside the front door of either school at 11 AM today (Thursday, April 2nd) or on Monday, April 6th.

2. Contacting us. If you have a library book, but you are not currently receiving lunches, please contact the MS/HS (for all K-12 students) at 402-225-3371, ext. 6100, & leaving a message OR by emailing aepley@southcentralusd.us -- and we will make arrangements to pick up the book(s) from you.

em.strong: Don't forget to take an AR test over your library book if you haven't already, and when you are ready for your next book, there are TONS of free resources available during our closure...

div.p: 1. EPIC. Soon (if not already) your child will be receiving an email to their Google email encouraging them to sign up for GetEpic.com - this website not only has free books for your children to read, BUT they also have some for the younger ones that will read the book to them! Teachers are creating (or have already created) your child's account so that they can see who has signed up & who is reading.
2. AMAZON PRIME. Don't forget that Amazon Prime has free downloads!

3. OVERDRIVE & SORA. Here are two apps that can help your children read free eBooks while they are away from school. Overdrive (computer) and Sora (mobile) allow students to access the NE Schools Digital Collection. Watch the videos for help connecting, and thank you Mr. Borer for sharing!

em.strong: Elementary students should be at 50% or more of their AR goal for the fourth quarter to be on track, and MS/HS students should be at 75% of their second semester goal by April 8th. The "celebration" for reaching your goal is still up in the air, so we will keep you posted on that.

a.aria-label: Read more about "Checking in" library books & finding more to read online...

div.p: All eLearning classes will officially begin on Monday, March 30th, while some have started already. Click the link HERE to see the lesson plans for our district's teachers. Please click on the links below for the following resources:

ul.li: SeeSaw for Preschool & Elementary (both parents/guardians will have an account -- Student accounts are on SeeSaw CLASS while family accounts are on the SeeSaw FAMILY app)

Video Conferencing is being held on a variety of platforms, mostly Zoom and Google Meet --> You will need the specific teacher's Zoom or Google Meet link to meet up online with the class & those are linked in the lesson plans above
PowerSchool is where you can check your child's participation in classes online

If our SCNUSD #5 students do not have internet, we are asking you to please contact Amanda Skalka at askalka@southcentralusd.us, as she is working with several providers to try to get internet to our family's homes. NOTE: In some cases, this is not possible due to line of sight issues for the provider or not being able to come into the homes during this time.

li.a: LN Preschool & Elementary Classroom Meeting Times & Links

ul.li: LN MS/HS Classroom Meeting Times (links are above in the lesson plans)

li.a: SC Preschool & Elementary Classroom Meeting Times & Links
SC MS/HS Classroom Meeting Times & Links

div.p: If you would like added to the district's breakfast & lunch program, please fill out the Google Form at http://bit.ly/COVID19LunchSurvey. Starting on Mon., Mar. 30th, meals will be delivered Monday - Thursday, and Thursday's meal will include Friday's breakfast & lunch AND Monday's breakfast items.

Please understand that lunch times vary daily, so there are times that the drivers may be running a little earlier or later for delivery, especially in the rural areas. The delivery includes lunch for that day, and breakfast for the following morning. Any child 18 and under in the district qualifies for the program (your lunch status does not matter), and there is no cost. If there is a day(s) that you will be gone & don't need the lunch, please call and leave a message at 402-726-2151.

em.strong: If you have a negative lunch balance from previously in the school year, we encourage you to mail your checks to:

div.p: Lawrence/Nelson School (this includes preschool through high school lunches)
Sandy Creek (for all preschool - high school lunch balances)

strong.em: Please note that all phone calls to the Lawrence/Nelson Preschool & Elementary School secretary are now being forwarded to the middle/high school in Nelson, as the preschool/elementary secretary is out on maternity leave! The number to the MS/HS in Nelson is 402-225-3371, and the extension is 6100.

div.p:
SCNUSD #5 offers healthy meals every day for your children! Breakfast costs $1.30, and lunch costs $2.55 (K-5th grade) and $2.60 (6th-12th Grade). Milk costs 40¢. If you would like to join your student for lunch, your cost is $3.50.
LAWRENCE/NELSON MENU LINK
SANDY CREEK MENU LINK
Children may also qualify for free/reduced lunches. Reduced price lunches are $0.30 for breakfast and $0.40 for lunch. If your child(ren) qualified for free or reduced-price meals at the end of last school year, you must submit a new application for . . .

div.p:
Current Positions Available
The South Central Unified School District is accepting applications for the following positions. Required forms can be found by clicking on the links listed here. Both the certified and classified staff positions require a background form.
Please open the appropriate forms and fill out online OR download the forms, and open them with Adobe Reader or Preview to fill in the application. The forms needed for each job are listed next to the corresponding opening. All open positions require TWO forms.
Certified Application OR Classified Application One Source Background Check & Summary AND DHHS Background Check (both are required)
Position Site Forms Required for Application Background
Status
Early Childhood SPED endorsement OR Elementary Education endorsement with SPED Sandy Creek Certified Application One Source Background Check & Summary, DHHS Background Check (2 pgs) OPEN 20-21
6-12 English or . . .
